New Records: In scoring 56 against Oman, Warner overtook Aaron Finch as Australia's all-time leading run-scorer in T20Is.
Key Match Events: David Warner and Marcus Stoinis shone through in difficult batting conditions.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted a high-stakes match between the holders of the T20 crown and the ODI crown.
Mitchell Marsh emphasized Australia's desire to add to England's sense of jeopardy.
Jos Buttler was anxious for things to go England's way to avoid further questions about the team's failures.
Mitchell Marsh mentioned the challenge of playing against England and the atmosphere created by English fans.
Post-Match Reflections: Jonny Bairstow reflected on the importance of winning more games than losing in tournament cricket.
Mitchell Marsh embraced the Ashes-style reception from England's travelling fans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a new surface at Kensington Oval, said to be the best one on the square.
A slightly patchy forecast could have given the teams another thing to contend with.
Others: England have a slight edge in the overall T20I head-to-head with Australia, winning 11 and losing 10.
There have only ever been two 200-plus scores in 25 completed T20Is at Kensington Oval.
